summary_reasoning: Key drivers are explicitly stated and proximate to forecasts: consolidated revenue CAGR (17% 2025–2029, 33% in 2025, ~13% 2026–2029), segment CAGRs (data center 20%, client 16%, gaming 20%, embedded 5%), AI GPU revenue path ($8.2B in 2025 to $17.9B in 2029), margin trajectory (gross to 57% by 2027; operating to 35% by 2029), and valuation inputs (COE/WACC 9%, long-run tax 15%, Stage II parameters, shares 1,637). Specificity is solid: magnitudes, units, and timeframes are provided and tables reconcile for growth rates and share count. Justification is partial: some references to management long-term targets, historical margin expansion, and industry context (Nvidia dominance, TAM >$500B) but limited tie-ins to multi-year history/peer benchmarks for WACC/tax or margin targets. Internal consistency appears mostly clean; adjusted vs GAAP margin references are somewhat ambiguous but not definitively contradictory to the tables. Stress testing is absent; no quantified sensitivities or scenario ranges are provided for material levers (AI GPU adoption, margins, WACC, China policy). Given explicitness and specificity but weak justification and no sensitivities, the assumptions quality is Fair.

assumptions_extracted.quote: We expect AMD to achieve a top-line compound annual growth rate of 17% from 2025 to 2029. We model 33% growth in 2025… We model an average annual growth rate of 13% from 2026 to 2029
For AMD’s data center segment… we model a 20% revenue CAGR over the next five years
We model AMD’s AI GPU revenue reaching $8.2 billion in 2025… We model AMD reaching $17.9 billion in AI GPU revenue in 2029
In client revenue (PC CPUs), we model a 16% CAGR… In gaming… 20% CAGR… We model a 5% CAGR for AMD’s embedded business
Adjusted gross margin… should reach management’s long-term target of 57% as soon as 2027… operating margin expansion to 35% in 2029
Cost of Equity % 9.0… Weighted Average Cost of Capital % 9.0… Long-Run Tax Rate % 15.0
Stage II EBI Growth Rate % 9.1… Stage II Investment Rate % 46.7… Perpetuity Year 15
We are re-inserting $1.2 billion of revenue in 2025 and $2.8 billion to our 2029 AI GPU estimates

unjustified_parameters: Stage II EBI Growth Rate 9.1% without source
